I enjoyed this place.  Some tapas were better than others for sure, but overall the food was of a high quality.  The bread it was served on was perfectly toasted and tasty, which added to the toppings greatly.  It was certainly better to wait for plates of tapas to come out and take the new ones, rather then picking the old ones that have been sitting out for a while.  This restaurant did seem to cater mostly to tourists, but I was a tourist, so that worked out fine :)  We got filled up for cheap.The pick-what-you want thing is great for people who may be reluctant to order something new at a restaurant; they can just sample one little tapas here and stop if they don't like it.   Also good for those struggling to speak the local language, as you just serve yourself - in any case the waitresses all seemed to speak English.
